text:
“Thank you. But will I bother the sick person by being here and talking?” Pyotr Petrovitch asked Zossimov.

“N-no,” Zossimov mumbled; “you can keep him company.” He yawned again.

“He has been awake for a long time, since morning,” Razumihin said. He seemed friendly, which made Pyotr Petrovitch feel a bit happier, maybe because this messy and rude guy called himself a student.

“Your mom,” Luzhin started.

“Hmm!” Razumihin cleared his throat loudly. Luzhin looked at him, curious.

“That’s fine, keep going.”

Luzhin shrugged his shoulders.

“Your mom started a letter to you while I was visiting her. When I got here, I waited a few days before coming to see you, so I could be sure you knew everything; but now, to my surprise…”

“I know, I know!” Raskolnikov suddenly said, annoyed. “So you are the fiancé? I know, and that’s enough!”

It was clear that Pyotr Petrovitch was upset this time, but he didn’t say anything. He struggled to understand what was happening. There was a moment of silence.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses impatience upon realizing that Pyotr Petrovitch is his mother's fiancé.
